content.description: Start right hand on low sidepull, left on high undercling (pad stack may be necessary), pull on and move right hand up to blunt thumbdercling, left hand goes out left to a small undercling feature and then the right hand either tracks into it or uses a wide pinch feature just above it. Bump out left to an intermediate crimp or go straight out to the right facing flake, match into it and then finish straight up as for Search Party.
content.location: Middle of the lost wall, just behind the lost crag area, this climb starts in front of the tree

content.description: Sit start with left hand on good right facing edge and right hand on small side pull a bit to the right. Pull on and move up through a couple right facing crimps to the large right facing flake above head height. From here go up left hand to a sidepull crimp and make a big reach up to a shelf up and right. Match up here, get high feet and then execute the topout moves through some sloping holds over the bulge.
content.location: In the middle of the lost wall, just left of the tree, the line goes straight up.

content.description: Sit start on the corner as for Lost My Keys, move up to the horizontal seam, then trend right out to the large right facing flake, once matched up on the flake continue straight up to finish as for Search Party.
content.location: Left arete of the lost wall trending into the center of the face, the boulder is located just behind the lost crag (lost corner/blacksmith specifically).

content.description: Sit start on rock sticking out of the ground at the arete, both hands in small pockets, opull on and make a move up to a juggy horizontal seam then continue on up the arete using a compy pocket and several slopey holds to top out just to the left of Search Party.
content.location: Left arete of the lost wall, just behind the left side of the lost crag

content.description: Sit start with left on right facing flake and right on edge just above it, move right hand straight up to a gaston, adjust feet and then track the left hand up into a small 2/3 finger blocky undercling. Move up right to a small crimp, bring the feet up, and then make a bigger move up left to sloping holds on a shelf above head height. Match up on that slopey shelf, get higher feet, and then topout straight up through several more slopey holds.
content.location: Right side of the lost wall, this climb starts just to the right of the tree.

content.description: Stand start at the base of the slab, move up the slab using the arete and a crack just inside the arete. Move up these features to the top of the boulder and rock over to finish the climb.
content.protection: 2-3 pads, there is possibility of a bad fall if the climbers falls off and to the right, be aware and have spotters if you don't feel comfortable when attempting.
content.location: Starting on the right side of the Lost Wall, above the entrance to the Lost Crag area.

content.description: Start as for lost on the flake and edge above it, move right hand out right to a good crimp, bring your feet up onto the big slab and then trend up and right through that slab to big shelf jugs for the topout.
content.location: Right most climb on the lost wall, starting to the right of the tree and continuing up and right through the small gulley.

content.description: The Lost Wall is a small vertical wall just above and behind the main Lost Crag area. It hosts several technical face climbs and is definitely worth checking out if you are in the area.
